long_term.title: Bakkt trading volumes spike to all-time highs. Will it last?
long_term.summary: The Bakkt Bitcoin futures exchange, backed by ICE, saw a significant 796% spike in trading volumes, reaching all-time highs. This surge, after a period of low activity, suggests growing institutional interest and potentially increased liquidity in the Bitcoin market. The sustainability of this volume increase will be a key indicator for future price action and market maturity.
long_term.rationale: A sustained increase in Bakkt volumes indicates growing institutional participation, which is a significant driver for long-term Bitcoin adoption and price appreciation. This could lead to greater liquidity and price discovery.

long_term.title: Litecoin proposes privacy upgrade designed with Bitcoin in mind
long_term.summary: Litecoin is exploring an opt-in privacy upgrade using MimbleWimble technology via a side-chain. This move, inspired by Bitcoin's development path, aims to enhance fungibility and privacy. If successfully implemented, it could set a precedent for other cryptocurrencies and signal a renewed focus on privacy features within the broader crypto ecosystem.
long_term.rationale: Privacy enhancements are a key area for crypto development. Successful implementation of MimbleWimble on Litecoin could boost its utility and adoption, potentially influencing Bitcoin's own privacy discussions.

long_term.title: Bitfinex to launch options and gold-backed stablecoin
long_term.summary: Bitfinex plans to introduce options trading in Q1 2020 and is exploring a gold-backed stablecoin, Tether Gold. These developments signal an expansion of derivative products and a move towards more traditional asset-backed stablecoins, catering to a broader range of investors and potentially increasing market depth and stability.
long_term.rationale: The introduction of options trading and a gold-backed stablecoin by a major exchange like Bitfinex can attract more sophisticated investors and provide hedging tools, contributing to market maturity and stability.

long_term.title: US Lawmakers Ask Fed to Consider Developing ‘National Digital Currency’
long_term.summary: Two US lawmakers have urged the Federal Reserve to explore the creation of a digital dollar. This reflects growing governmental interest in central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) and the potential impact of private cryptocurrencies on the US dollar's global role. Such a development could significantly alter the regulatory landscape and adoption of digital assets.
long_term.rationale: Governmental exploration of CBDCs, especially in the US, could lead to significant regulatory shifts and potentially legitimize or compete with existing cryptocurrencies, impacting long-term adoption and market structure.

long_term.title: Coinbase Expands Reach of Visa Card in Europe, Adds 5 New Cryptos
long_term.summary: Coinbase has expanded its Visa debit card availability to 10 more European countries and added support for five new cryptocurrencies (XRP, BAT, REP, ZRX, XLM). This move increases the utility and accessibility of crypto for everyday spending, fostering broader adoption and integration with traditional financial systems.
long_term.rationale: Expanding crypto debit card services to more users and adding more supported assets directly increases crypto's utility and accessibility, driving adoption and on-chain activity.

long_term.title: Former World Gold Council Exec Develops New Bitcoin ETF
long_term.summary: A former executive from the World Gold Council is developing a Bitcoin ETF with Kryptoin Investment Advisors, filing with the SEC. This signifies continued efforts by traditional finance professionals to bring regulated crypto investment products to market, which could unlock significant institutional capital.
long_term.rationale: The development of a Bitcoin ETF by a seasoned traditional finance executive, coupled with an SEC filing, represents a major step towards institutional adoption and could unlock substantial capital inflows.

long_term.title: Square Cash App Q3 bitcoin sales topped a record $148 million, up over 245% since last year
long_term.summary: Square's Cash App reported record Bitcoin sales of $148 million in Q3 2019, a 245% increase year-over-year. This growth, attributed partly to a redesigned interface, highlights increasing retail adoption of Bitcoin through user-friendly platforms.
long_term.rationale: Strong retail adoption via platforms like Square's Cash App indicates growing mainstream acceptance and usage of Bitcoin for transactions, contributing to its long-term value proposition.

long_term.title: Byrne Sells Overstock Stake to Buy Crypto and Battle ‘Deep State’
long_term.summary: Former Overstock CEO Patrick Byrne sold his stake in the company to invest in cryptocurrency, gold, and silver, citing a desire for counter-cyclical investments. This move by a prominent figure, who has long supported crypto, signals continued conviction in digital assets as a hedge against traditional economic instability.
long_term.rationale: High-profile individuals like Patrick Byrne investing significant capital into crypto reinforces its narrative as a potential store of value and hedge against economic uncertainty, attracting further attention.

long_term.title: Bitcoin flirts with $10,000 per coin price, retreats to $9,400
long_term.summary: Bitcoin briefly touched $10,000, influenced by China's renewed interest in blockchain technology, before retreating to the mid-$9,000s. This price action highlights the market's sensitivity to geopolitical and technological developments, particularly from major economies.
long_term.rationale: China's endorsement of blockchain technology can be a significant long-term catalyst for crypto adoption. However, Bitcoin's inability to sustain the $10,000 level indicates short-term resistance and potential for consolidation.

long_term.title: Bitmain’s new Texas-based Bitcoin mining facility is finally open
long_term.summary: Bitcoin mining giant Bitmain has officially opened its large-scale mining facility in Rockdale, Texas, with plans to expand its energy capacity significantly. This expansion by a major mining hardware manufacturer in the US indicates a growing global hash rate and potential for increased mining efficiency and decentralization.
long_term.rationale: The opening of a large Bitmain mining facility in Texas signifies increased investment in mining infrastructure, potentially boosting the global hash rate and demonstrating geographical diversification of mining operations.

short_term.title: The Crypto Daily – Movers and Shakers -18/11/19
short_term.summary: Bitcoin saw a slight rise of 0.16% on Sunday, closing at $8,537.3. After an initial dip, it rallied to a high of $8,699.5 before easing back below $8,600. The price action indicates intraday volatility and a struggle to maintain upward momentum above key resistance levels.
short_term.rationale: Bitcoin's inability to hold above $8,600 suggests short-term consolidation and potential for a minor pullback, with resistance at $8,586.97.

short_term.title: Bitcoin Cash – ABC, Litecoin and Ripple Daily Analysis – 18/11/19
short_term.summary: Bitcoin Cash ABC rose 1.01% on Sunday, ending the week down 8.63%. It experienced intraday volatility, finding support at $260.23 before bouncing to $269.59, breaking through resistance at $267.01. The overall weekly trend remains bearish.
short_term.rationale: Despite a slight daily gain, the overall weekly decline for BCH ABC suggests continued bearish pressure in the short term.

short_term.title: Latest Bitcoin price and analysis (BTC to USD)
short_term.summary: Bitcoin (BTC) is trading just above $8,440, down 3% from last Monday and below its 200-day EMA. It has been consolidating since October, failing to break above $10,000 and making lower highs, indicating bearish sentiment.
short_term.rationale: Trading below the 200-day EMA and making lower highs suggests a bearish short-term outlook, with potential for further downside if support at $8,000 is breached.

short_term.title: IOV Labs (RSK) and Monday Capital's Ecosystem Fund Announces Close of First Round of Investments
short_term.summary: IOV Labs (RSK) and Monday Capital's Ecosystem Fund has closed its first round of investments in ventures like Vega, Multis, and Pocket Network. This indicates continued development and funding within the RSK ecosystem, potentially driving adoption and innovation on the platform.
short_term.rationale: Funding for ecosystem projects can lead to increased development and adoption of the underlying technology, providing a subtle positive signal for the platform's growth.

short_term.title: Northern Bitcoin Merges with Leading US Competitor
short_term.summary: Northern Bitcoin AG is merging with Whinstone US, Inc., aiming to build the world's largest Bitcoin mining facility in Texas. This merger consolidates significant mining power and positions the combined entity as a major global player, potentially impacting hash rate distribution and operational efficiency.
short_term.rationale: The merger creates a larger, more efficient mining operation, which can positively influence the network's hash rate and potentially lead to more stable mining economics.

short_term.title: Former ConsenSys executive says Bitcoin will increase ‘stability for the average person’
short_term.summary: A former ConsenSys executive, Kavita Gupta, discussed cryptocurrencies on TED, highlighting their potential to replace outdated monetary systems and provide stability in countries facing inflation. This public endorsement on a major platform could influence broader public perception.
short_term.rationale: Positive commentary from influential figures on mainstream platforms can subtly boost public interest and confidence in cryptocurrencies, potentially leading to increased adoption.

short_term.title: Former PayPal CFO has bank account closed without warning
short_term.summary: Former PayPal CFO Roelof Botha reported his Bank of America account being closed without explanation, a situation often linked to cryptocurrency transactions. This highlights ongoing de-risking by traditional financial institutions, which can create friction for crypto users.
short_term.rationale: Instances of banks closing accounts, even if unconfirmed to be crypto-related, create uncertainty and can impact liquidity for crypto businesses and individuals, posing a short-term risk.

short_term.title: Tron (TRX) falls 9 percent following Justin Sun’s banking fiasco
short_term.summary: Tron (TRX) dropped nearly 9% amid a general market downturn and news that its founder, Justin Sun, might be losing access to bank accounts. This highlights the sensitivity of altcoins to founder-related news and broader market sentiment.
short_term.rationale: The significant drop in TRX, linked to both market conditions and founder-specific issues, indicates high short-term volatility and negative sentiment for the altcoin.

short_term.title: IRS investigators scrutinize Bitcoin ATMs and kiosks
short_term.summary: The IRS is actively investigating Bitcoin ATMs for potential money laundering and tax evasion. This increased regulatory scrutiny on on-ramps could create friction for retail users and potentially impact the ease of fiat-to-crypto conversions.
short_term.rationale: Increased IRS scrutiny on Bitcoin ATMs could lead to stricter compliance measures, potentially slowing down retail adoption and increasing operational costs for ATM providers.

short_term.title: IRS investigators scrutinize Bitcoin ATMs and kiosks
short_term.summary: The IRS is actively investigating Bitcoin ATMs for potential money laundering and tax evasion. This increased regulatory scrutiny on on-ramps could create friction for retail users and potentially impact the ease of fiat-to-crypto conversions.
short_term.rationale: Increased IRS scrutiny on Bitcoin ATMs could lead to stricter compliance measures, potentially slowing down retail adoption and increasing operational costs for ATM providers.

daily_view.summary: Bitcoin is showing signs of short-term bearishness, trading below its 200-day EMA and making lower highs, with key support levels being tested. However, longer-term bullish catalysts remain, including institutional interest via Bakkt and ETF filings, and growing retail adoption through platforms like Square. Regulatory scrutiny on Bitcoin ATMs presents a short-term headwind, while positive developments in mining infrastructure and ecosystem funding offer underlying support.
key_risks: Continued bearish price action below key technical indicators (200-day EMA).
Increased regulatory scrutiny on fiat on-ramps like Bitcoin ATMs.
Potential for further de-risking by traditional financial institutions impacting liquidity.
Altcoin-specific negative news (e.g., Tron/Justin Sun) dragging down sentiment.
watch_items: Bitcoin's ability to reclaim the 200-day EMA.
Bakkt volume trends for institutional adoption signals.
Developments on potential Bitcoin ETF approvals.
Any further news regarding bank account closures for crypto figures.
US regulatory stance on crypto ATMs.
